question: Which book was written by Mark Twain?
description:
Image 1: This is the cover of "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest" by Ken Kesey. The cover features a photograph of a sterile, institutional hallway with a door at the end. The title and author's name are prominently displayed in large white font against the blue-toned background.

Image 2: This is the cover of "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer" by Mark Twain. The cover has an illustration depicting two children, a boy and a girl, walking outdoors. The boy is wearing overalls and holding a red object, while the girl is dressed in a pink dress. The background shows a sunny outdoor scene with other people and buildings. The title and author's name are written in bold black letters at the top.

Image 3: This is the cover of "Of Mice & Men" by John Steinbeck. The cover features a minimalist design with a silhouette of two men walking side by side along a dirt path under a tree. The title and author's name are written in simple, elegant fonts at the top.

Image 4: This is the cover of "Catch-22" by Joseph Heller. The cover is predominantly blue with the title in large white letters at the top. Below the title, there is a small red figure running and a small black airplane flying. The author's name is written in white at the bottom.


Answer to the question: B. Image 2
